overview_of_class: The central goal of the class is to help students perform and understand a selection of contemporary American short stories and three great American novels. Emphasis is on narratology and the adaptation and staging of fiction through solo and group performances. Prerequisite: Gen Cmn 103: the Analysis and Performance of Literature or its equivalent. The course requires solo and group performance and written analytical essays. We constantly use a workshop approach and experiment with different ways to adapt and stage fiction.
name: Performance of Narrative Fiction
subject: PERF_ST
